member.name: T:stellar_dotnet_sdk.Asset
member.summary: Asset class represents an asset, either the native asset (XLM) or a asset code / issuer account ID pair. An asset code describes an asset code and issuer pair. In the case of the native asset XLM, the issuer will be null.

member.name: T:stellar_dotnet_sdk.AssetTypeCreditAlphaNum
member.summary: Assets are uniquely identified by the asset code and the issuer. Ultimately, it’s up to the issuer to set the asset code. By convention, however, currencies should be represented by the appropriate ISO 4217 code. For stocks and bonds, use the appropriate ISIN number.

member.name: T:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource
member.summary: An EventSource represents a long-lived HTTP connection through which a Web server can “push” textual messages. To use these “Server Sent Events”, pass the server URL to the EventSource() constructor and then register a message event handler on the resulting Event Source object. The EventSource attempts to be resilient to transitory network errors and interruptions by automatically retrying connections to maintain persistence.

member.name: T:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.EventSourceState
member.summary: The possible values of the readyState property.

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The URL.

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The URL.

member.name: E:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.Error
member.summary: Occurs when an error occurs.

member.name: E:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.Message
member.summary: Occurs when a message is available.

member.name: E:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.StateChange
member.summary: Occurs when the ready state changes.

member.name: P:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.Headers
member.summary: Gets or sets the headers to be sent in the request. For more customization override the ConfigureWebRequest method.

member.name: P:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.MessageTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional message type filter. If set, this filter specifies which event types to pass through.

member.name: P:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.LastEventId
member.summary: Gets the last event identifier.

member.name: P:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.ReadyState
member.summary: Gets the state of the connection.

member.name: P:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial connection timeout. There is no timeout on the connection once established.

member.name: P:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.Url
member.summary: The absolute URL to which the EventSource is connected.

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.Connect
member.summary: Begin the process to connect to the the EventSource. The EventSource attempts to be resilient to transitory network errors and interruptions by automatically retrying connections to maintain persistence.

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.Shutdown
member.summary: This method shutsdown the connection.

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.ConfigureWebRequest(System.Net.HttpWebRequest)
member.summary: Configures the web request object. Override this method to add custom headers and settings to the request object as required.
member.param: The HttpWebRequest request.

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.DispatchEvent(System.String[])
member.summary: Called when a complete message is received (indicates by two newlines) to process the line(s) and dispatch the event. Override this method to customize the parsing.
member.param: The lines received.

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.IsWanted(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified event type is filtered. By default this checks against the list of MessageTypes (if specified) but can be overriden for additional tests.
member.param: Type of the event.
member.returns: [True] if the message should be processed.

member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.

member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.OnStateChangeEvent(stellar_dotnet_sdk.EventSource.StateChangeEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.

member.summary: Retries the connection after delay using a simple backoff mechanism.

member.summary: Closes the connection.

member.summary: Connects to the event source.

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.federation.Federation.Resolve(System.String)
member.summary:
This method is a helper method for handling user inputs that contain `destination` value. It accepts two types of values: For Stellar address (ex. bob*stellar.org`) it splits Stellar address and then tries to find information about federation server in stellar.toml file for a given domain.
For account ID (ex. GB5XVAABEQMY63WTHDQ5RXADGYF345VWMNPTN2GFUDZT57D57ZQTJ7PS) it simply returns the given Account ID.
member.param: Stellar address or account id

member.name: T:stellar_dotnet_sdk.federation.FederationResponse
member.summary: Object to hold a response from a federation server. See https://www.stellar.org/developers/learn/concepts/federation.html

member.name: T:stellar_dotnet_sdk.federation.FederationServer
member.summary: FederationServer handles a network connection to a federation server (https://www.stellar.org/developers/learn/concepts/federation.html) instance and exposes an interface for requests to that instance. For resolving a stellar address without knowing which federation server to query use Federation#resolve(String). See Federation docs: https://www.stellar.org/developers/learn/concepts/federation.html

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.federation.FederationServer.CreateForDomain(System.String)
member.summary: reates a instance for a given domain. It tries to find a federation server URL in stellar.toml file. See: https://www.stellar.org/developers/learn/concepts/stellar-toml.html
member.param: Domain to find a federation server for

member.name: T:stellar_dotnet_sdk.federation.FederationServerInvalidException
member.summary: Federation server is invalid (malformed URL, not HTTPS, etc.)

member.name: T:stellar_dotnet_sdk.federation.NoFederationServerException
member.summary: Federation server was not found in stellar.toml file.

member.name: T:stellar_dotnet_sdk.responses.operations.OperationResponseLinks
member.summary:
The response is for the genesis ledger of the Stellar network, and the links in the _links attribute provide links to other relavant resources in Horizon. The key of each link specifies that links relation to the current resource, and transactions means “Transactions that occurred in this operation”.
The transactions link is also templated, which means that the href attribute of the link is actually a URI template, as specified by RFC 6570. We use URI templates to show you what parameters a give resource can take.

member.name: T:stellar_dotnet_sdk.responses.operations.PathPaymentOperationResponse
member.summary: Sends an amount in a specific asset to a destination account through a path of offers. This allows the asset sent (e.g., 450 XLM) to be different from the asset received (e.g, 6 BTC). See: https://www.stellar.org/developers/horizon/reference/resources/operation.html

member.param: The amount of destination asset the destination account receives.
The amount of source asset deducted from senders account.
Account address that is sending the payment.
Account address that receives the payment.
Account address that receives the payment.
The asset code (Alpha4, Alpha12, etc.)
The account that created the asset
The asset type (USD, BTC, etc.) to be sent.
The asset code (Alpha4, Alpha12, etc.) to be sent
The account that created the asset to be sent.

member.summary: This operation sets the options for an account. See: https://www.stellar.org/developers/horizon/reference/resources/operation.html

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.responses.operations.SetOptionsOperationResponse.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,stellar_dotnet_sdk.KeyPair,System.String,stellar_dotnet_sdk.KeyPair,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String[],System.String[])
member.param: A number from 0-255 representing the threshold this account sets on all operations it performs that have a low threshold.
A number from 0-255 representing the threshold this account sets on all operations it performs that have a medium threshold.
A number from 0-255 representing the threshold this account sets on all operations it performs that have a high threshold.
Account of the inflation destination.
Sets the home domain of an account.
Add, update, or remove a signer from an account.
Weight of the signer.
Weight of the master key.

Indicates which flags to clear. For details about the flags, please refer to the accounts doc. The bit mask integer subtracts from the existing flags of the account. This allows for setting specific bits without knowledge of existing flags.

Indicates which flags to set. For details about the flags, please refer to the accounts doc. The bit mask integer adds onto the existing flags of the account. This allows for setting specific bits without knowledge of existing flags.

member.name: M:stellar_dotnet_sdk.responses.SubmitTransactionResponse.GetOfferIdFromResult(System.Int32)
member.summary: Helper method that returns Offer ID for ManageOffer from TransactionResult Xdr. This is helpful when you need ID of an offer to update it later.
member.param: Position of ManageOffer operation. If ManageOffer is second operation in this transaction this should be equal 1.
member.returns: Offer ID or null when operation at position is not a ManageOffer operation or error has occurred.
